H0.text: Resulted from sexual reproduction is evidence that a plant having traits identical to its parent plant provides.

H1.text: Resulted from asexual reproduction, a plant that has traits identical to the parent plant provides evidence that the plant.

H2.text: Will develop many seeds indicates that a plant with traits identical to the parent plant will produce many seeds.

H3.text: Will have large leaves is evidence that a plant that has traits identical to the parent plant provides evidence that the plant.

A4.text: Vegetative reproduction is usually considered a cloning method.

A5.text: Many plants actually are chimeras and cuttings might reflect the attributes of only one or some of the parent cell lines.

A6.text: Apomixis mainly occurs in two forms: In gametophytic apomixis, the embryo arises from an unfertilized egg within a diploid embryo sac that was formed without completing meiosis.

A7.text: Vegetative propagation is a type of asexual reproduction found in plants where new individuals are formed without the production of seeds or spores and thus without syngamy or meiosis.
